name: Document
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Natural Language.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloud— we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var language = gcloud.language();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var language = gcloud.language({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Document
methods.description: Create a Natural Language Document object. From this object, you will be able to run multiple detections.

examples.caption: Create a Document object with pre-defined configuration, such as its language.

params.name: config
params.description: • Configuration object, the inline content of the document, or a Storage File object.

params.name: options.content
params.description: • If using config as an object to specify the encoding and/or language of the document, use this property to pass the inline content of the document or a Storage File object.

params.name: options.encoding
params.description: • UTF8, UTF16, or UTF32. See EncodingType.

params.name: options.language
params.description: • The language of the text.

methods.name: annotate
methods.description:
Run an annotation of the text from the document.

By default, all annotation types are requested:

  • The sentiment of the document (positive or negative)
  • The entities of the document (people, places, things, etc.)
  • The syntax of the document (adjectives, nouns, verbs, etc.)

See the examples below for how to request a subset of those types.

If you only need one type of annotation, you may appreciate one of these other methods from our API:

  • language#detectEntities
  • language#detectSentiment
  • language#detectSyntax

examples.caption: To request only certain annotation types, provide an options object.
Verbose mode may also be enabled for more detailed results.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See documents.annotateText.

params.name: options.entities
params.description: • Detect the entities from this document. By default, all features (entities, sentiment, and syntax) are enabled. By overriding any of these values, all defaults are switched to false.

params.name: options.sentiment
params.description: • Detect the sentiment from this document. By default, all features (entities, sentiment, and syntax) are enabled. By overriding any of these values, all defaults are switched to false.

params.name: options.syntax
params.description: • Detect the syntax from this document. By default, all features (entities, sentiment, and syntax) are enabled. By overriding any of these values, all defaults are switched to false.

params.name: options.verbose
params.description: • Enable verbose mode for more detailed results. Default: false

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error occurred while making this request.

params.name: callback.annotation
params.description: • The formatted API response.

params.name: callback.annotation.language
params.description: • The language detected from the text.

params.name: callback.annotation.sentiment
params.description: • A value in the range of -1 (negative) to 1 (positive).

params.name: callback.annotation.entities
params.description: • The recognized entities from the text, grouped by the type of entity.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.art
params.description: • Art entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.events
params.description: • Event entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.goods
params.description: • Consumer good entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.organizations
params.description: • Organization entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.other
params.description: • Other entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.people
params.description: • People entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.places
params.description: • Place entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.entities.unknown
params.description: • Unknown entities detected from the text. This is only present if detections of this type were found.

params.name: callback.annotation.sentences
params.description: • Sentences detected from the text.

params.name: callback.annotation.tokens
params.description: • Parts of speech that were detected from the text.

params.name: callback.annotation.tokens[].text
params.description: • The piece of text analyzed.

params.name: callback.annotation.tokens[].partOfSpeech
params.description: • A description of the part of speech (Noun (common and propert), Verb (all tenses and modes), etc.).

params.name: callback.annotation.tokens[].tag
params.description: • A short code for the type of speech (NOUN, VERB, etc.).

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].aspect
params.description: • The characteristic of a verb that expresses time flow during an event.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].case
params.description: • The grammatical function performed by a noun or pronoun in a phrase, clause, or sentence.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].form
params.description: • Form categorizes different forms of verbs, adjectives, adverbs, etc.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].gender
params.description: • Gender classes of nouns reflected in the behaviour of associated words

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].mood
params.description: • The grammatical feature of verbs, used for showing modality and attitude.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].number
params.description: • Count distinctions.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].person
params.description: • The distinction between the speaker, second person, third person, etc.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].proper
params.description: • This category shows if the token is part of a proper name.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].reciprocity
params.description: • Reciprocal features of a pronoun

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].tense
params.description: • Time reference.

params.name: callback.annotations.tokens[].voice
params.description: • The relationship between the action that a verb expresses and the participants identified by its arguments.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.caption: Verbose mode may also be enabled for more detailed results.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: detectSentiment
methods.description: Detect the sentiment of the text in this document.

examples.caption: Verbose mode may also be enabled for more detailed results.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See documents.annotateText.

params.name: options.verbose
params.description: • Enable verbose mode for more detailed results. Default: false

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error occurred while making this request.

params.name: callback.sentiment
params.description: • A value in the range of -1 (negative) to 1 (positive).

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.caption: Verbose mode may also be enabled for more detailed results.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.description: • Configuration object. See documents.annotateSyntax.

params.name: options.verbose
params.description: • Enable verbose mode for more detailed results. Default: false

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error occurred while making this request.

params.name: callback.syntax
params.description: • The syntax recognized from the text.

params.name: callback.syntax.language
params.description: • The language detected from the text.

params.name: callback.syntax.sentences
params.description: • Sentences detected from the text.

params.name: callback.syntax.tokens
params.description: • Parts of speech that were detected from the text.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
